entry.title: Director-A4
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is seeking a Director of Patient Financial Services to join its Administrative Services team. The Director of Patient Financial Services will serve a key role in the college with responsibility for directing revenue cycle functions related to patient accounts in the College of Dentistry outpatient clinics. Reporting to the Chief Administrative Officer, this is a high impact position that ensures the timely and accurate execution of all billing and collection activities with a strong focus on optimizing revenue and contributing to the financial strength of the college. The Patient Financial Services team commits to delivering accurate, timely and professional customer service to enhance patient satisfaction while continually assessing and refining processes to ensure best practices in billing and collections that comply with all applicable college procedures, university policies, state and federal laws and other regulatory agencies.

The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the third largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions or academic units. All major ADA-recognized dental specialties are represented. Under the direction of the Chief Administrative Officer, the Director of Patient Services is responsible for providing strategic and tactical leadership of the Patient Financial Services Department. This position will be specifically responsible for revenue cycle functions related to patient accounts in the College of Dentistry outpatient clinics including but not limited to: billing of clinical activities to patients, claims submissions to Medicare, Medicaid, and 3rd party payers, insurance verification and precertification processes, cash collections and deposits and management of accounts receivable; ensuring compliance with all Federal, State, University and health care regulations and procedures; maintaining appropriate accounting controls over accounts receivable and cash, and designing, implementing and maintaining all billing and receivables systems, policies and procedures; work closely with the College’s senior leadership to maximize revenue generation opportunities related to our clinical operations by monitoring billing compliance, establishing sound fee-setting strategies and procedures, by acting as liaison with 3rd party payers and by providing data, reports and analysis of patient, government and managed care payers to determine trends and implement plans of action to address potential issues; manage, train and develop staff, oversee the departmental budget, and promote sound cash management principles within the department.

This position requires successful completion of drug & alcohol screening.

entry.title: Director-00
entry.content:
The Organization Established in 2008, the Office of Investments was created to ensure strategic management of the University's Long-Term Investment Pool. The Office of Investment's goal is to deliver long-term, attractive, risk-adjusted returns to support the educational and research goals of the university. The investment team continuously strives to identify market opportunities where price and underlying value are misaligned. The Office of Investments has adopted an asset allocation model that groups assets into three broad thematic categories. This model enables the investment team to be responsive to changing market conditions. The asset allocation model is implemented by partnering with external managers, which allows the Office of Investments to build a portfolio of specialized investment teams from around the world to implement our strategic allocation. The investment portfolio currently includes public equity, fixed income, hedge funds, and real assets. While generating strong real returns over market cycles is important, we also believe active risk management is a critical part of our investment process. Our mission is to focus on the management of the $3.6 billion University's Long-Term Investment Pool with the goal of delivering strong risk-adjusted rates of returns over time. We strive to manage the portfolio for maximum long-term real returns commensurate with the risk tolerance of the University.

The Opportunity The Office of Investments is seeking to hire a Senior Investment Director responsible for managing the private equity team and leading all requirements of the private equity program, which includes real estate, venture capital, private credit and real assets, developing and recommending portfolio construction strategies, leading the sourcing of new private equity investment opportunities (partnership commitments and co-investments), analyzing, negotiating and recommending investments, monitoring investment activities, participating on advisory committees and establishing goals. Recruits, trains, coaches and evaluates junior investment staff. Requires domestic and international travel related to annual and advisory committee meetings, due diligence meetings and industry conferences, an energetic and disciplined approach to investment, and an ability to develop a continually expanding global network within the investment management community.

entry.title: Medical Claims Specialist
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry seeks a Dental/Med Specialist to join its Patient Financial Services team. The Patient Financial Services team supports the undergraduate and graduate outpatient clinics ensuring compliance with all clinical and financial requirements related to billing and collection of patient accounts. The Medical Claims Specialist's primary responsibilities include insurance verification, acceptance of patient funds for co-payments and deductibles at time of service, collection of patient outstanding accounts, and other customer service functions while providing patients with exceptional customer service. The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions with all major ADA-recognized dental specialties represented. The Medical Claims Specialist will serve the patients of the College of Dentistry by verifying insurance coverages and performing cashier and collections functions. The proportion of time this position will perform each of these functions will vary based on the needs of the clinics. Additional responsibilities include; answering phones; greeting patients; verification and interpretation of insurance coverage; processing of patient payments; serves as liaison between doctors, patients, and payers; maintains files and/or sorts and distributes mail; copies, collates and/or staples material(s); performs data entry and prepares data for analysis; prepares graphs and charts; answers inquiries and provides customer service; checks and verifies data; and prepares reports or presentations; performs other duties as directed.

This position works Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm; may require some weekend or evening work for special projects or shift shortage; requires successful completion of drug & alcohol test; work is performed primarily in an office environment and the employee in this position is subject to indoor environmental conditions; requires sustained periods using a keyboard and performing other computer work as well as reviewing documents both in hard copy and electronic formats; sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, which permits the employee to function in a general office environment to accomplish tasks.

The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions or academic units. All major ADA-recognized dental specialties are represented.

Under the direction of the Chief Administrative Officer, the Sr. Financial Analyst is responsible for providing insightful analysis as a basis for information dissemination, strategic planning and decision making related to the operational and financial performance of the College. Through the establishment of performance metrics and standards; comparisons to identified standards, targets, and/or strategic plans; identification of trends and areas of performance opportunity; assessment of information needs and development of appropriate analytic databases, systems, processes and business intelligence tools; preparation of reports; determination of appropriate methodologies; preparation of complex analyses; development of models and forecasts; interpretation of data; presentation of information; development and presentation of recommendations; all that collectively provide thorough decision support to the senior leaders of the College.

entry.title: Maxillo Pros Dent Lab Tech
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the nation and it is the only state-supported dental school in Ohio. It supports specialty and advanced dental education programs in 9 distinct disciplines and houses fully-equipped and staffed fixed and removable labs. Through an affiliation arrangement with the James Comprehensive Cancer Center the College of Dentistry is able to ensure cancer patients have access to the most advanced oral health care.

The College of Dentistry seeks a trained dental technician to support the clinical activities of Cancer Center’s Department of Maxillofacial Prosthodontics and Oncology Service. He/she will assist in the fabrication of intra and extra-oral prostheses, including obturators and implant support structures. Clinical care of patients occurs in the Cancer Center with laboratory facility support for the position at both the Center and the College of Dentistry.

The body must be able to reach, bend, stoop and reach in order to perform most lab procedures. The ability to sit and stand for duration of time is also necessary. Other specific requirements include color spectrum differentiation; manual dexterity/motor coordination, hand-eye coordination, physical communications; visual acuity and communication/language development. Individuals in this position may be exposed to the following: chemical hazards (skin irritants); equipment; use of sharp instruments; and latex. This position requires successful completeion of a drug and alocohol screening.

entry.title: Maintenance Repair Worker 2
entry.content: This position performs maintenance and inspection to building operating systems; performs both routine and programmed maintenance checks; makes necessary repairs or adjustments to electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and other systems; performs miscellaneous tasks as required; provides a high level of customer service; communicates to customers, coworkers and supervision via written, electronic, and verbal methods and devices.

entry.title: Director of Development
entry.content: The Director of Development develops and implements short- and long-term plans to secure foundation grants targeted at the $100,000 level. This position will work with academic and non-academic units on campus to proactively assist in identifying new foundation prospects and move them through the fundraising continuum to solicitation and stewardship; will assist with raising the Foundation Relations profile campus-wide; develope fundraising projections and managing personal plans to achieve identified annual goals. This position requires exceptional interpersonal skills and a highly self-motivated individual who enjoys working in a team environment. Hours vary and some travel is required.

entry.title: Senior Director of Development
entry.content: The Senior Director of Development will develop and implement long and short term plans to secure major gifts from alumni, friends, volunteers, corporations, foundations and other entities for the Fisher College of Business (FCOB).

entry.title: Marketing Representative
entry.content:
The Business Development Manager is responsible for assisting in achieving market sales goals through his or her own direct sales and through participation in the implementation of OSC's overall AweSim market strategy. This position is an outside sales role that focuses on executing a consultative sales approach of computational services and resources to small- and medium-sized businesses. Compensation will include a base salary as well as target-based annual incentives.

Responsibilities include: Develop and execute sales strategies; develop customer groups and solicit customer feedback; prepare and present documentation, reports, presentations, and papers detailing plans and results; identify market segments and target markets based on existing market survey results and additional market research as needed; analyze marketing metrics to identify cause and effect relationships; create target client databases and capture market data Analyze competitors; assess OSC's AweSim program promotional needs and work with OSC's communication department to produce appropriate materials; evaluate demographics, prices, distribution channels, and marketing outlets; work independently to create defined milestones and deliverables.

entry.title: Office Associate
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is seeking an Office Associate for its Division of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery and Anesthesiology (OMFS). OMFS offers a full scope of surgical techniques for a variety of problems of the face and mouth. Many of our faculty surgeons have particular expertise in select sub-specialties, including temporomandibular disorder, nerve repair, orthognathic surgery, and cleft lip and palate repair. The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions with all major ADA-recognized dental specialties represented. This position serves as the administrative support for Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and Anesthesiology residency programs within the College of Dentistry; performs transcription services; prepares correspondence; records statistical clinical data; records and maintains resident information; performs data entry; assists in the coordination of the programs including accreditation; assists in the preparation and distribution of program materials; provides information to the public regarding the programs; assists with coordination of externship programs; maintains compliance records; acts as liaison between program applicants and the Program Director.

This position requires successful completion of background check(s) and drug & alcohol screening; work is performed primarily in an office environment and the employee in this position is subject to indoor environmental conditions; requires sustained periods using a keyboard and performing other computer work as well as reviewing and tying documents and reports; requires sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, which permits the employee to function in a general office environment to accomplish tasks.

entry.title: Human Resources Associate
entry.content: The Human Resource Associate provides human resources assistance with basic HR functions, including talent acquisition, HR policy and procedure development, compliance, and HR project implementation; responsible for the initiation of HR action requests, including hires, terminations, job openings, additional pays, PETs and JED updates, reclassifications and promotions; reviews and monitors all HR action requests to ensure timely and accurate processing.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
The John Glenn College of Public Affairs at the Ohio State University welcomes applicants for a tenure-track position at the assistant or junior associate level in Social Policy. We especially encourage applications from scholars who study the impact of social policies on diverse populations. Topical areas of interest include (but are not limited to) poverty and inequality, education and workforce development, crime, housing and consumer finance, immigration, and health. We welcome scholars employing a variety of methodological approaches, so long as the research demonstrates analytical rigor and relevance for public policy.

The position begins fall 2016. Salary will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications. Applicants must have completed or be nearing completion of all Ph.D. degree requirements. Successful candidates will likely have doctorates in public affairs, public policy, psychology, sociology, political science, economics, or a related field. Highly desirable candidates will have practical experience, university teaching experience, and experience mentoring members of underrepresented groups.

The John Glenn College of Public Affairs (glenn.osu.edu) is the newest college at The Ohio State University. Our curricular offerings include the NASPAA-accredited Master of Public Administration and In-Career Master of Arts in Public Administration; dual master’s degrees with schools of Law, City and Regional Planning, Public Health, Natural Resources, Social Work, Business Administration, and Agricultural/Environmental/Development Economics; a joint degree in Arts Policy and Administration; a Ph.D. in Public Policy and Management; a Bachelor of Arts in Public Affairs; and a variety of undergraduate and graduate minors.

The College is located in a state-of-the-art building, Page Hall, in the center of the University campus. The Ohio State University, the flag-ship public university of Ohio, is located in the state’s capital, Columbus, providing direct access to public sector organizations and practitioners from all levels of government, as well as a large and vibrant nonprofit and philanthropic community. Columbus is the 15th largest city in the United States and was recently rated by Forbes as the No. 1 opportunity city in the country.

The Ohio State University is committed to establishing a culturally and intellectually diverse environment, encouraging all members of our learning community to reach their full potential. We are responsive to dual-career families and strongly promote work-life balance to support our community members through a suite of institutionalized policies. We are an NSF Advance Institution and a member of the Ohio/Western Pennsylvania/West Virginia Higher Education Recruitment Consortium.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
The John Glenn College of Public Affairs at the Ohio State University welcomes applicants for a tenure-track position at the assistant or junior associate level in the management of public and/or nonprofit organizations. We especially encourage applications from scholars who study management issues related to diverse populations. Topical areas of interest include (but are not limited to) studies of individual and group behavior, organizational leadership, managerial decision making, public budgeting and financial management, strategic management, and inter-organizational and cross-sector collaboration. We welcome scholars employing a variety of methodological approaches, so long as the research demonstrates analytical rigor and relevance for management practice.

The position begins fall 2016. Salary will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications. Applicants must have completed, or be nearing completion of all Ph.D. degree requirements. Successful candidates will likely have doctorates in public affairs, public or nonprofit management, public policy, business, psychology, sociology, political science, economics, or a related field. Highly desirable candidates will have experience working with nonprofit or public organizations, university teaching experience, and experience mentoring members of underrepresented groups.

The John Glenn College of Public Affairs (glenn.osu.edu) is the newest college at The Ohio State University. Our curricular offerings include the NASPAA-accredited Master of Public Administration and In-Career Master of Arts in Public Administration; dual master’s degrees with schools of Law, City and Regional Planning, Public Health, Natural Resources, Social Work, Business Administration, and Agricultural/Environmental/Development Economics; a joint degree in Arts Policy and Administration; a Ph.D. in Public Policy and Management; a Bachelor of Arts in Public Affairs; and a variety of undergraduate and graduate minors.

The College is located in a state-of-the-art building, Page Hall, in the center of the University campus. The Ohio State University, the flag-ship public university of Ohio, is located in the state’s capital, Columbus, providing direct access to public sector organizations and practitioners from all levels of government, as well as a large and vibrant nonprofit and philanthropic community. Columbus is the 15th largest city in the United States and was recently rated by Forbes as the No. 1 opportunity city in the country.

The Ohio State University is committed to establishing a culturally and intellectually diverse environment, encouraging all members of our learning community to reach their full potential. We are responsive to dual-career families and strongly promote work-life balance to support our community members through a suite of institutionalized policies. We are an NSF Advance Institution and a member of the Ohio/Western Pennsylvania/West Virginia Higher Education Recruitment Consortium.

entry.title: Program Specialist
entry.content:
The Department of Statistics in the College of Arts and Sciences at The Ohio State University invites applications for an Open Rank Faculty / Data Analytics Program Specialist position to begin in the Autumn Semester of 2016. This is a hybrid position that consists of a 45% appointment as a non-tenure-track faculty member and a 55% appointment as a data analytics program specialist. The focus of this non-tenure-track faculty position is the enhancement of student learning in the university’s new undergraduate Data Analytics major (http://data-analytics.osu.edu) through teaching and program support and development. We seek individuals who are committed to excellence in undergraduate teaching and education and have interests and expertise in areas of statistics related to data analytics.

Summary of Data Analytics Program Specialist Duties (55%): The program specialist coordinates the delivery of Data Analytics major courses under the direction of the Co-Director; assists regular faculty in the development of curricular materials for the Data Analytics major; actively seeks grant funding for proposed projects and initiatives as they pertain to undergraduate data analytics education; assists faculty instructors in finding and preparing appropriate data sets for homework and lab assignments; assists with the coordination of capstone courses for the Data Analytics major; assists with ongoing assessment of the Data Analytics major program in coordination with the Co-Directors and the major’s Academic Planning Specialist; assists instructors in the coordination of class projects; supervises Data Analytics GTAs and undergraduate graders; assists the Vice Chair in coordinating Data Analytics GTA teaching schedules; coordinates and schedules Data Analytics GTAs for the Data Analytics component of the Mathematics and Statistics Learning Center; trains GTAs in statistical education methodologies; assists in designing programs for improving the teaching skills of GTAs, including ongoing teacher training, support, and evaluation; serves on the departmental teaching evaluation committee for GTAs; performs follow-up evaluations of Data Analytics GTAs during the academic year; mentors Data Analytics undergraduate students in data challenges and other contests/projects; coordinates ASA Data Fests held here at OSU.

Summary of Faculty Duties (45%): This faculty position has been designed to allow a motivated individual to impact undergraduate education both inside and outside of the classroom. The faculty portion of the appointment entails teaching three to four undergraduate statistics courses per year (nine contact credit hours). For appointment at the associate or full level, applicants should have demonstrated ability for leadership in the practice of data analytics and in statistical pedagogy and academic program development at the undergraduate level. For appointment at the assistant level, applicants should have evidence of excellence in teaching at the undergraduate level and expertise in modern data analytic methods.

To build a diverse workforce Ohio State encourages applications from minorities, veterans, women, and individuals with disabilities. Flexible work options available. EEO/AA Employer. Ohio State is an NSF Advance Institution.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a temporary 80% FTE fall semester position.

The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Greenhouse Coordinator
entry.content: This position coordinates horticulture greenhouse/nursery operations to support the academic mission of Ohio State ATI (Agricultural Technical Institute) within the College of Food Agricultural, and Environmental Science; oversees comprehensive horticulture crop production; manages greenhouse and nursery space for teaching, production, and research; implements crop production procedures in keeping with course content and best industry practices; designs and constructs equipment for greenhouse production, teaching, and research; advises faculty, staff, students, and student employees on materials needed and proper greenhouse techniques; specifies and purchases materials, supplies, and equipment; serves as liaison between horticulture faculty, staff, and other departments as well as other government and industry persons and the public; monitors the operation of facility equipment and maintains the comprehensive greenhouse/nursery complex; implements strict sanitation practices to showcase the facility; prepares equipment and materials for practicums, labs, and ongoing demonstrative production in support of educational goals; performs ongoing programming and updating of greenhouse computer control systems; administers an Integrated Pest Management driven pest and disease control strategy including, but not limited to, pesticide applications for pest and pathogen control/prevention; coordinates new equipment procurement and installation; maintains accurate, up-to-date records of production crops, the conservatory collection, purchases, student employees, crop schedules and rotations; plans and carries out plant sales; supervises, schedules, and trains practicum students and student greenhouse/nursery employees; participates in planning, installation and maintenance of campus gardens; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content:
The Diversity Outreach and Engagement Coordinator serves as the Co-Chair for both the Underrepresented Recruitment and Outreach and Engagement Subcommittees of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion's Diversity Council. The primary function includes but not limited to creating and advocating actions, approaches, systems and programs that assist the University in recruiting and retaining underrepresented students (including first-generation), works closely with students, faculty, staff, schools and community-based organizations to accomplish the mission of the University relative to issues of access, affordability, engagement and completion for underrepresented students (including first-generation) by developing and implementing sustained partnerships and creating a culture of diversity and inclusion on campus.

The Diversity Outreach and Engagement Coordinator will also plan, implement and evaluate diverse programs, events and activities to create and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and equity at Ohio State Lima. In so doing, the Diversity Outreach and Engagement Coordinator will work with a wide range of constituents, departments and offices (internally and externally) to assess programmatic needs that support contemporary diversity, inclusion, equity and multi-ethnic issues and will serve as an advisor for the Student Multicultural Club.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: OhioLINK is seeking a Digital Curation Coordinator to assist in ensuring long-term access to digital content managed by OhioLINK. This set of content currently includes one of North America's largest collections of electronic journals, an electronic book collection, a shared electronic dissertation and theses collection for Ohio colleges and universities and a digital resources center that includes a shared music and video collection. The Digital Curation Coordinator will manage OhioLINK's implementation of the Rosetta digital preservation platform; assist in developing required policies and procedures related to digital collections and preservation; represent OhioLINK at digital curation events; and interact with OhioLINK members on issues related to digital curation. The Digital Curation Coordinator will report to Manager, Member and User Services.

entry.title: Systems Developer/Engineer
entry.content: The EndPoint Engineer is responsible for the development, implementation, and management of the enterprise desktop environment. This position is for an experienced, self-motivated individual to lead projects and oversee the daily execution of processes, operations, and support activities for client technologies. This person will work closely with Security, Management and the Service Desk to ensure that 'best-practice' procedures and technologies are introduced, as well as, established enterprise practices are maintained.

entry.title: Post Doctoral Researcher
entry.content: The Department of Psychology Stress and Immunity Cancer Projects (SICP) has an available position for a Post Doctoral Researcher; the ideal candidate has a research interest and experience in psychological treatments for cancer or other medically ill patients, biobehavioral research including immunology, and/or dissemination and implementation research with mental health community partners. This position performs study management, including supervising and directing research staff and developing therapy protocols; analyzes data, writes manuscripts, and prepares grants; provides diagnostic interviewing, assessment, and treatment of cancer patients; additional research projects are easily and immediately available with existing datasets and ongoing accrual; career development activities include multidisciplinary and multi-institutional collaboration, advance training in quantitative methods, scholarly writing, grantsmanship, and graduate student mentoring.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content: From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni. This position will be responsible for teaching, research, and service for the Department of Marketing & Logistics.

entry.title: Senior Research Associate-B/H
entry.content: Seeking a highly motivated research associate to work in the laboratory of Dr. Dean VanNasdale at the Ohio State University College of Optometry. The primary focus of the lab is retinal imaging with an emphasis on high resolution techniques using adaptive optics and optical coherence tomography. Responsibilities will include: working with PI in the development/adaptation of imaging instrumentation for novel applications and managing the maintenance of existing instrumentation; responsible for collecting, processing and analyzing ocular imaging data; participation in preparation of manuscripts for projects and grant proposals.

entry.title: Staff Training & Devpt Coord
entry.content: This position works with the Director of the Student Service Center to develop and implement the training strategy for the Student Service Center (SSC), including the Admissions and Orientation Contact Center (AOCC) and the Student Center Mentors; leads or coordinates the assessment, design, development, implementation and evaluation of training programs and resources, and provides in-depth consultation and expertise to staff and key constituents on services performed in the SSC; collaborates with stakeholder offices to ensure all SSC staff, including student staff, have the knowledge and skills necessary to provide outstanding service to our students, prospective students, and families.

entry.title: Asst Director of Development
entry.content: The Associate Director of Development for The Ohio State University College of Food, Agricultural, and Environmental Sciences develops and implements short- and long-term plans to secure major gifts from individuals in support of the college's and university's missions, objectives and priorities as set by the college dean, with a primary focus on OSU Extension; responsible for building a solid channel of major gift prospects for the department of Extension.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content:
The position is an Assistant Professor of Art, focused in New Media Art; this is a full-time, tenure-eligible position. The Department of Art and the Advanced Computing Center for the Arts and Design (ACCAD) seek a candidate whose practice engages emerging technologies and finds relationships and expressive modes of production across multiple disciplines, such as traditional and non-traditional art practices, the humanities, the sciences and engineering.

As part of the College of Arts & Sciences, the Department of Art at The Ohio State University is broad-based, both discipline intensive and boundary pushing, a modern laboratory in which to create and explore art and ideas. Through the production, examination, and evaluation of the arts, the Department of Art serves as a place where students and faculty can experiment with material and content, and where a diverse audience can take part in our exhibitions, public lectures, and educational programming.

As part of this joint position, this faculty member will contribute to the community of faculty and students pursuing creative research at the world-renown Advanced Computing Center for the Arts and Design (see accad.osu.edu for more information). This collaborative space hosts experimental and collaborative projects as well as technology-related courses, both of which will be a part of this position. To meet this expectation, the successful applicant should excel at participating as a productive member of collaborative cross-disciplinary teams. The person in this position will teach courses to undergraduate and graduate students, conduct research/creative activity, and provide service.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a temporary 20% FTE fall semester position.
The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni.

This position teaches and advises undergraduate, graduate, and PhD level students in Finance. Research in area of concentration; serves on department, college, and university committees.

entry.title: Program Manager
entry.content:
From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni.

This position provides coordination of both on-site, web-based, and virtual activities and initiatives related to Working Professional MBA (WPMBA) student job search resources, programming and job search consultation, and career coaching; provides job search consultation to WPMBA students regarding job search transitions and career advancement including career exploration, career planning, job search strategy development, and implementation.

entry.title: Human Resources Associate
entry.content: This position provides human resources support for Engineering Administration and Civil, Environmental and Geodetic Engineering; works as a team member to provide high level customer service to faculty, staff, and students, ensuring processing is timely, efficient, accurate and in compliance; handles the employment lifecycle process for all graduate and hourly student appointments, including processing all student appointment requests; works with faculty, Graduate School, and Associate Fiscal Officers to ensure appropriate appointment designation, funding availability and compliance requirements; responsible for initiating and troubleshooting student appointment matters in compliance with university policies; supports staff and/or faculty employment process, as needed; initiates human resource transactions including employment transactions, payroll transactions, and position updates; responsible for ensuring all required documentation is obtained and conforms to university guidelines prior to submitting for approval; as directed by the college Internal Control structure, ensures segregation of duties in the processing of every transaction, appropriate mandatory approvals and reconciliation; initiates, verifies and answers questions related to new hire paperwork, letters of offer, and graduate contracts; processes and ensures employee eligibility verification; assists with immigration processing for international students and employees; provides employment verification and travel letters as requested; monitors timekeeping and leave; works with the College Business Operations Center to ensure efficient processing of human resource transactions; responds to inquiries from faculty, staff, and students regarding human resources policies and consults with college Human Resources Generalist or Human Resources Managers, as required; maintains personnel records and department reports; works with team members to build cross-functional skills to serve as backup to Fiscal Associate; serves on committees and/or works on special projects.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: Coordinates the collection, processing, and reporting of clinical compliance data; manages the Student Health database; monitors the clinical compliance status of students enrolled in the undergraduate and graduate programs; generates reports to verify compliance status; communicates effectively with faculty and collaborates with staff at Wilce Student Health Center.

entry.title: Administrative Associate 1
entry.content: This position supervises administrative activities in a large academic department with over 50 main campus faculty and 130 graduate students; develops administrative procedures; manages and coordinates department faculty recruitment and appointments; oversees consistency and currency of all department policies and documents; coordinates department P&T process; writes and prepares administrative reports; represents the department to other administrators, university leadership, and outside agencies; prepares and/or oversees production of annual reports, faculty load reports, and other similar documents; serves as department liaison to the Development Office; develops plans for development activities and events; acts as official contact for alumni, donors, and friends; monitors the financial status of development funds; plans departmental events; resolves departmental operating problems and complaints from faculty and students; manages departmental communications; coordinates with ASC Communication Services for external communications and promotional material, including the departmental newsletter/magazine; manages the request and compilation of content for communication purposes; serves as Executive Assistant to the Chair; advises chair and faculty on departmental and university policies and procedures; participates in department fiscal activities, including travel and eRequests; serves as office manager in absence of department HR/Fiscal Officer; serves as backup to the front desk; participates in department meetings and takes meeting minutes.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: This position is responsible for managing all departmental events; plans, organizes, and executes comprehensive event details for named lectures, seminars, symposiums, conferences, meetings, programs, ground breakings, staff appreciation events, convocation, and any special events; serves as dotted-line supervisor to administrative staff who are assigned to assist with departmental events; develops and manages overall communication strategy for the department; independently plans, develops, and designs marketing materials; investigates, generates, and writes stories for electronic and social media; serves as CBC alumni contact, maintains alumni listing, leads alumni communications, and plans alumni events; manages student staff; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Registered Veterinary Tech
entry.content: Works in the Anesthesia Section of the Veterinary Medical Center under the direction of the supervisor and faculty Veterinary Anesthesiologists; provides anesthesia service for surgical, medical and diagnostic cases of small and large animals; reviews patients' medical histories and determines appropriate pre-anesthetic and anesthetic agents to be administered; administers anesthesia; monitors patient condition & response throughout the procedures and during recovery phase; enters charges into hospital information system; stocks supplies; maintains anesthesia equipment; assists with instructing students on anesthesia techniques, agents and equipment; works 9 am - 6 pm; participates in small animal emergency on-call anesthesia service; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content: This position will expand knowledge through research, teaching and service activities in astronomy department with vital scientific atmosphere; teaches graduate and undergraduate astronomy courses; performs original research in area of specialization; advises students; performs service functions for the Department and University.

entry.title: Systems Specialist-A&P
entry.content: Responsible for receiving, resolving, escalating, and monitoring customer issues/requests; provides immediate assistance and problem resolution, whenever possible, for service inquiries concerning utilization and information regarding all University computer systems applications, telephony and paging systems, personal computers and peripherals; critical tasks performed by this area also includes communicating, tracking and reporting computing environment outages.

entry.title: Student Services Specialist
entry.content: The Student Services Specialist provides in-depth expertise to customers through interpretation, guidance and direction in support of financial aid, residency, records and registration, and student account services offered by the University. This position serves as the primary point of entry for students, parents and internal customers and utilizes in-depth analysis of the university's student information systems to address troubleshooting and serve the customer through various mediums (phone, email, in-person, etc). Activities include but are not limited to: in-depth analysis of needs, investigation of alternative solutions, development of recommendations for solutions, and implementation of solutions. This position functions with a moderate to high degree of autonomy and makes decisions according to established policies and procedures.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
This faculty position provides overall leadership for developing and implementing a comprehensive and balanced teaching and applied research agenda for the Agriculture and Natural Resources program area within the Department of Extension in the College of Food, Agricultural, and Environmental Sciences (CFAES) at The Ohio State University; working collaboratively with a team of OSU professionals within OSU Extension, with cross-disciplinary departments and colleges, as well as with appropriate industry and farmers, the faculty member functions as a consultant with clientele to address statewide and local issues as expertise is needed; provides unbiased research-based alternatives; evaluates and responds to large-scale statewide needs vs. individual requests; and secures resources (grants, contracts, user fees) to focus on these issues; faculty member will seek courtesy faculty status within a department close to their work; additionally, they will maintain an integrated connection with campus departments and Ohio Agricultural Research and Development Center (OARDC) to further their work and help disseminate current research to address needs.

This position is field-based, with several options for work location.

Duties and Responsibilities: Plan, teach and evaluate educational programs, including development of relevant curricula; conduct applied research; make creative and scholarly contributions, and contribute in service to the profession and university in agronomy, soil science, and cropping systems disciplines; employ innovative educational methods and technology to expand delivery of educational programs and resources; document and communicate program impact; be an effective team player working collaboratively with Extension educators/employees in all program areas where interdisciplinary efforts are needed to address broad issues or carryout major program efforts; conduct applied research; translate and integrate applied research results into curriculum and educational programs; publish in clientele media outlets; meet faculty expectations of creative and scholarly work; collaborate with academic department faculty on research agendas; secure extramural funding through grants, contracts, industry supported partnerships, user fees and cost recovery to support mission critical programming; develop and maintain a positive working relationship with clientele and stakeholders; be active in Extension, research, and service activities at the state level; pilot new approaches and advance existing techniques in collaboration with personnel from other states where applicable; serve as an educational advisor and liaison for the Ohio State University Extension and the University to appropriate public issue and program-related organizations, represent OSU Extension and CFAES with federal, state and local agencies and educational institution at regional and national levels; ensure diversity among potential clientele and learners with appropriate access to programs and facilities without regard to age, race, creed, color handicap, sex, sexual orientation, developmental disability, national origin, marital status, arrest or non-program related conviction record.

The Ohio State University is committed to establishing a culturally and intellectually diverse environment, and encourages all members of our learning community to reach their full potential. We are responsive to dual-career families and strongly promote work-life balance to support our community members through a suite of institutionalized policies. We are an NSF Advance Institution and a member of the Ohio/Western Pennsylvania/West Virginia Higher Education Recruitment Consortium.

entry.title: Coordinator-Building Services
entry.content: This position will assist the building coordinator in all aspects of building maintenance, event set up, and daily operations for the Woody Hayes Athletic Center; coordinates facility needs for all units housed in the facilities; coordinates and supervises daily set up for athletic practices; supervises daily cleaning and maintenance; is responsible for daily pool chemical application and maintenance; coordinates set up needs for all events in facility, supervises daily cleaning and upkeep; supervision of facility staff at events; acts as coordinator between Athletic Facility Operations and all users of the Woody Hayes Athletic Center; supervises set up and care for Football, Field Hockey, M/W Tennis, M/W Lacrosse, M/W Soccer, Softball, Baseball and any other sports as well as camps, clinics, banquets and special events; monitors all work projects and performs cost analysis; maintains records of event expenses and assists in preparation of billing information; tracks spending and monitors budgets; assists in purchasing decisions; maintains supply and inventory and prepares related records; attends meetings and training sessions; assists with general administration of the facility operations office including completing payroll for staff; performs related duties as assigned.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content: The Ohio State University (www.osu.edu) invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position (focusing on the rank of Assistant Professor) in the newly created Department of Engineering Education (EED). Our newly formed Department (http://eed.osu.edu) is expanding its core team of faculty. The Department’s mission includes advancing the engineering profession and enabling student success by 1) developing and delivering state-of-the-art, innovative, multidisciplinary engineering courses and programs 2) modeling and advocating scholarly, evidence-based teaching within the College of Engineering; and 3) integrating pedagogical discovery, practice, and dissemination through world-class engineering education research. The EED extends the national and global reputation of the Engineering Education Innovation Center (EEIC), which, since 2007, has been a lynchpin of undergraduate curriculum development and scholarly teaching in the College of Engineering. With curriculum founded on first-year core courses, technical writing, a multi-disciplinary capstone and other specialized courses, the EEIC became the Department of Engineering Education in November 2015. The Department will build upon the strengths of the EEIC while creating new opportunities for innovation via engineering education research, teaching at the undergraduate and graduate levels, and growing the Ph.D. program. This position will start August 2016.

entry.title: Research Specialist
entry.content: Plans, implements and evaluates the creation, calibration, and execution of structural finite element models for the Simulation Innovation and Modeling Center (SIMCenter); develops and maintains proficiency in a number of structural finite element software packages; conducts crash simulation of large structures; develops application-focused learning modules for SIMCenter educational initiatives; mentors students in the area of structural finite element analysis.

entry.title: Grants & Contracts Admin
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry seeks a Grant Administrator to join the Office of Research. The Grant Administrator’s primary responsibilities include managing the grant administration for the College including pre-award, post-award, and monitors and reporting. The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions with all major ADA-recognized dental specialties represented.

This position works Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm; may require some weekend or evening work for special projects; requires successful completion of a drug & alcohol test; work is performed primarily in an office environment and the employee in this position is subject to indoor environmental condition; requires sustained periods using a keyboard and performing other computer work as well as reviewing documents both in hard copy and electronic formats; requires sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, which permits the employee to function in a general office environment to accomplish tasks.

entry.title: Asst Early Chldhd Specialist
entry.content: The Early Childhood Teaching Assistant assists in supervising and integrating daily and long-term planning for the classroom in collaboration with co-lead teachers in the A. Sophie Rogers Laboratory School at Schoenbaum Family Center at Weinland Park; ensures social, emotional, physical, and educational needs of children are met within the framework of the schools philosophy; assists with implementing, evaluating, and communicating classroom programming, research, routines, and procedures; assists in management of classroom by completing paperwork and problem solving with team and parents to address classroom issues; participates in ongoing professional development; attends staff meetings; participates in classroom supplies/materials/ environment; work in a flexible, collaborative, research-based environment; adheres to and implements the Head Start Performance Standards and reporting requirements; adheres to and implements the Child and Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) standards and reporting requirements.

entry.title: Dental Technician 2
entry.content:
The Restorative/Prosthodontics Division is seeking a Dental Lab Technician 2 for its Dental Lab. The division focuses on replacement of missing teeth and esthetic restorations through complete oral rehabilitation including an understanding of the dynamics of a smile, the preservation of a healthy mouth and the creation of tooth replacements. Faculty, students and staff collaborate with general dentists, specialists and other health professionals to develop solutions to dental and oral health concerns. The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions with all major ADA-recognized dental specialties are represented. The College has approximately 600 students in its undergraduate and graduate programs.

The Dental Lab Technician 2 duties in the dental laboratory includes the following: fabricating complete dentures and removable partial dentures, duplicating casts, repairing partial and complete dentures, and fabricating complex maxillofacial prostheses under guidance of prosthodontist and/or lab supervisor; requires successful completion of a drug & alcohol screening; body must be able to reach, bend, stoop and reach in order to perform most lab procedures; ability to sit and stand for a duration of time is also necessary; other specific requirements include color spectrum differentiation; manual dexterity/motor coordination, hand-eye coordination, physical communications; visual acuity and communication/language development. Individuals in this position may be exposed to the following: chemical hazards (skin irritants); equipment; use of sharp instruments; and latex.

entry.title: OSU Extension Educator
entry.content: The Extension Educator, Agriculture and Natural Resources in Noble County, will provide overall leadership to developing and conducting a proactive applied research and education program in agriculture and natural resources to meet current and future needs in farm management, livestock and crop production, food security, home horticulture/Master Gardeners, commercial horticulture, farm land-use issues, innovative agricultural business opportunities, environmental quality and sustainability, renewable energy, and bio-based products; work collaboratively with the team of Extension professionals to provide agriculture and natural resources programming within the Buckeye Hills Extension Education and Research Area (EERA); plan, teach, deliver, and evaluate educational programs on public issues such as water quality, food safety, natural resources, rural economic development, biotechnology, land use, zoning, and agricultural profitability; provide leadership to the development of pro-active educational programs using innovative educational methods; supervise a part-time horticulture Program Assistant and the Master Gardener/OVCN program; work closely with local advisory committees and volunteers to conduct needs assessment and priority setting to determine emphasis of educational programs.

entry.title: Administrative Associate 2
entry.content: This position serves as the fiscal and human resources manager for the Department of Theatre; develops and manages all budgets for the department; establishes controls to maintain budget limitations; collaborates with chair to prepare budget projections and plans; oversees and coordinates fiscal and HR activity including primary responsibilities for appointments/hiring, faculty promotion and tenure process, annual faculty and staff performance reviews, faculty travel and leave requests, time keeping, additional pay, and letters of offer; maintains personnel files and fiscal records; oversees production of budget and annual reports and other similar documents; advises chair regarding finances and reports and reconciles fiscal data and reports; provides administrative support to chair, coordinates office functions and resolves operating problems and employee issues; hires, trains, supervises, and assigns work to staff and student employees; reports to the Chair.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content:
The College of Education and Human Ecology invites applicants for an assistant professor, full-time (9 month) position in Counselor Education, School Counseling. The Counselor Education program is a dynamic, nationally ranked graduate program offering a PhD and two MA tracks in School Counseling and Clinical Mental Health Counseling. Both tracks prepare students for licensure in their areas. The School Counseling track places special emphasis on social justice; urban schools; and working with students of color, low income populations, and other diverse student populations. Furthermore, the School Counseling track emphasizes the ASCA National Model with a focus on counseling; leadership; and child, adolescent, and adult development. We have a vibrant partnership with our community schools, and the ideal candidate will have skills and interest in fostering these interdisciplinary collaborative relationships working with teachers, administrators, school psychologists, etc. The Counselor Education program has a commitment to diversity at the research, training, and service levels.

RESPONSIBILITIES: The successful candidate will conduct research in the area of school counseling as a discipline and pursue extramural funding related to the applicant’s area of research and scholarship, teaching, and service; collaborate in research and scholarship with faculty in similar or other disciplines; provide graduate instruction, including master’s and doctoral level courses in general counselor education and school counseling; participate in outreach and service activities associated with professional development in schools and other practitioner-related activities, particularly in urban schools and community settings; advise master’s and doctoral level graduate students with a focus on school counseling; use technology in instruction; provide leadership in service related to school counseling and youth assistance at the local, state, and national levels; collaborate with faculty and students in similar and related disciplines, and in general contribute to a nationally ranked counselor education program. There also are possibilities for undergraduate teaching based on interest and experience.

entry.title: Research Assistant 1-B/H
entry.content: The position will support a research project designed to help the Ohio Division of Wildlife understand how historical changes in the lower food web and environmental conditions have influenced Lake Erie’s fish community. This research project will primarily be laboratory-based, with some limited opportunities to do field work. Duties will include enumeration of phytoplankton and zooplankton samples (primary responsibility), facilitating project activities (see below), and participating in group meetings. Additional project activities: This position will be responsible for maintaining accurate records of our sample repository from a Lake Erie lower food web long-term monitoring program; will aid in processing biological samples (chlorophyll and fish) and have some data entry responsibilities.

entry.title: Systems Specialist-A&P
entry.content: Responsible for monitoring the OARnet Backbone, LAN and Systems and reacting to alarms/events generated within an infrastructure-monitoring platform based on corresponding procedures; coordinating the Service Desk response to alarms/events and ensuring standard, daily processes are followed; act as a liaison for Tier 3 for daily activities and in response to alarms/events; troubleshoot and monitor activity through the network; proactively monitors Ohio Academic Resource Network (OARnet) backbone using provided monitoring tools; assists clients in troubleshooting backbone connectivity issues and service concerns Interact with Install and Network Engineers in maintaining a service infrastructure that delivers Video, High Speed data and Telephony services; maintain service level agreements by maintaining Service Desk escalation time lines and continuous reassessment of open issues; isolate and diagnose faults and manage resolution with appropriate department; interact with departments to address issues identified within the network; generate reports on issue and network trends; adhere to OARnet and department policy and practice in an effort to assure prompt resolution to identified problems; actively work with Engineering Tier 3 group and Client Services team on problem resolution activities; may be required to be available during off duty hours and/or on call; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Research Aide
entry.content: Under the general direction of the Dining and Residence Hall Manager and the Manager of Stone Laboratory, assists with all aspects of the Stone Lab operations with an emphasis in residence and dining hall operations; performs specific hands-on-duties related to residence and dining hall operations; assists other Stone Lab operations associates to ensure optimal operation of the residence and dining hall; develops ways to ensure quality customer service to students, faculty, staff, and guests of Stone Lab; position is a temporary appointment that will last from mid-April to late October, 2016 (flexible beginning and end dates); position located at Put-In-Bay, Ohio.There are two available positions with this job opening.

entry.title: Office Assistant
entry.content: Provides general office support to various areas of Benefits and HR Customer Service; scans and indexes HR forms; prepares and sends form letters and information to university staff and faculty; verifies and inputs data; utilizes and maintains various databases; runs reports; opens, sorts, and date stamps mail; backs up lobby customer service representative and other team members by assisting customers in person, by phone, and email; works in a team environment to achieve service standards; maintains survey knowledge of departments of the Office of Human Resources and OSU employee benefit plans and processes; participates in regular training.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content: From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni. This position teaches undergraduate or graduate finance courses.

entry.title: Coordinator-College Commun
entry.content: Working directly with the Arts and Sciences Chief Communications Officer and the Assistant Dean for Strategic Recruitment and Diversity, the Recruitment Marketing Manager will develop, implement and maintain recruitment marketing strategies and activities to promote, expand, and advance recruitment and diversity services and initiatives in the College of Arts and Sciences. This position works collaboratively with a number of departments and administrative units in the college and throughout the university (e.g., admissions, development, alumni relations, student affairs, and academic affairs, etc.). This individual will develop and execute strategies to attract prospective students and parents, engage alumni, parents and friends and communicate with the campus community; will oversee a number social and digital media initiatives, provide and compel marketing copy for e-campaigns, marketing materials, websites and social media platforms in collaboration with ASC Communications Services.

entry.title: Chair
entry.content: The Chair will be fully dedicated to academic leadership and to sustaining and enhancing the scholarly mission of the department throughout the state of Ohio, nationally and internationally. This position will lead an internationally recognized faculty that has provided leadership in a broad range of areas critical to education and that has a deep and energetic commitment to diversity and equity; engages in creative and collaborative endeavors to deepen and broaden the interests of the department; manages an extensive budget, supervises a large and diverse faculty and staff, develops and implements governing policies in collaboration with faculty, cultivates relationships with groups both inside and outside the university, and engages as a full member of the college's leadership team.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a temporary 60% FTE fall semester position.
The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; Assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Office Associate
entry.content: This position provides assistance and clerical support to faculty, staff and students in the School of Environment and Natural Resources; performs a wide variety of duties that allows faculty to concentrate on their teaching and research duties and provides assistance to central operations, with primary responsibility for several business office functions; serves as liaison between faculty and students; assists graduate students and undergraduate students; utilizes word processing and/or graphics software to prepare correspondence, and complex documents; arranges meetings for faculty groups; coordinates special events; performs various fiscal functions and works in consultation with fiscal manager/fiscal team; runs monthly gas cylinder demurrage reports and verifies funding availability; arranges and processes travel requests and reimbursements; initiates eRequests; supports P-card management and performs reconciliation; provides eRequest training to new faculty/staff; participates in SENR fiscal and administrative support team meetings; prioritizes own work; trains and supervises student employees; has a dotted line to fiscal manager.

entry.title: Program Manager
entry.content:
From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni.

This position manages planning and delivery activities for custom and open enrollment Executive Education programs; facilitates logistics, including scheduling of program sessions, event space, and catering; manages associated program expenses through eRequest, eTravel, and HR Action; coordinates with faculty for teaching assignments; works with faculty on compensation contracting and the preparation/purchasing of required session materials; provides onsite program administration (and offsite as necessary); assists with program communications, client/participant requests, and financial/final reporting; serves as a liaison between Executive Education, university faculty, and senior client representatives in planning the delivery of programs; facilitates additional Executive Education events and activities as needed.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: Program coordinator for the University Honors & Scholars Program is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing activities for the University Honors Program; develops and manages the program budget(s); monitors expenses of the program; provides support to the Assistant Director of Student Engagement; serves as the H&S liaison to colleges and departments to build relationships and promote student engagement with campus partners; participates in all types of recruitment events as needed; supervises the Honors Graduate Administrative Associates (GAAs).

entry.title: Information Associate
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry seeks an Information Associate to join its Orthodontic Division. The Orthodontics Division provides excellent, comprehensive orthodontic treatment for all ages, and offers traditional braces as well as more invisible options such as Invisalign and the new lingual braces, Harmony. The orthodontic faculty members are leaders in their profession, and you will work with respected clinicians and educators work along with our orthodontic resident to provide the best care to our patients. The Ohio State University is the fourth largest dental college in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions with all major ADA-recognized dental specialties represented.

The information associate provides clinical office and project coordination for the graduate and pre-doctoral orthodontic clinics, clinic manager and clinic coordinator; performs data collection, entry, analysis, and reporting; interfaces with patients, parents, faculty, and residents and staff to schedule and coordinate patient care; develops and maintains databases; assists clinic manager, faculty, staff and students with coordination of quality and outcome measures, including patient satisfaction; creates presentations; provides internal support for clinical information system software; works with patient accounts and ensures that patient accounts are financially current and follows up on delinquent accounts; position requires some evening work and successful completion of an alcohol screening; work is performed primarily in an office environment and the employee in this class is subject to inside environmental conditions. This position requires sustained periods using a keyboard and performing other computer work; requires sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, which permits the employee to function in a general office environment to accomplish tasks.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content: Assistant professor with research and teaching focus in one of these two areas: Inorganic Materials synthesis OR Materials Characterization. Duties include teaching graduate and undergraduate courses; maintains an active research program; advises students; and performs service functions for the department, college, and university. This position is partially funded by Ohio State's Discovery Themes Initiative, a significant faculty hiring investment in key thematic areas in which the university can build on its culture of academic collaboration to make a global impact.

entry.title: Delivery Worker 2
entry.content: This position serves as an active member of a diverse Logistics and Distribution department; performs pickup, sorting and delivery functions for US Mail, Campus Mail, Parcels and freight items from multiple origins; operates up to 24 foot long straight truck; loads and unloads vehicles; utilizes appropriate freight moving equipment as needed; maintains delivery records; obtains signatures from customers; inspects and maintains cleanliness of vehicles; reports vehicle problems to supervisor; maintains documents associated with delivery manifests and vehicle records; maintains safe operations by complying with organization operational policies, procedures, and standards, as well as state and local driving rules and regulations; utilizes handheld scanner to process orders; works day shift Monday-Friday.

entry.title: Associate Director
entry.content:
