Under the direction of Associate Vice President within the College of Food, Agricultural and Environmental Sciences (CFAES) and the The Ohio State University (OSU) Wooster Campus, the Director of the Program of Excellence in Natural Rubber Alternatives(PENRA), this position leads the effort in developing and cultivating private sector relationships, with an industry focus; is responsible for assuring effective communications to all institutional, industrial and public PENRA collaborators; facilitates public relationships at local state and federal levels consistent with Ohio State University policies and strategies; position is responsible for supporting Faculty Leads and PENRA collaboration in the establishment and implementation of annual strategic and operational plans for PENRA, assuring the plan is developed in response to collaborative expectations, and maintains accountability to established milestones; position is responsible for the PENRA direct expense budget, supported by industry and OARDC contributions, this position is accountable for consistent execution of agreed governance compliance for the collaboration.

The Director of PENRA will develop in depth relationships with PENRA collaborators, specifically industrial partners; develops business plan strategy and collaborates with the PENRA faculty to integrate technology plans consistent with agreed to milestones in the stage gate process; collaborates with PENRA executive leadership in creating the annual direct PENRA operating budget; administers tactical operational budget control, working directly with OARDC Fiscal Office; provides the lead role in securing internal and external funding to support direct PENRA budget; contributes to the identification and development of funding sources, in addition to, established funding from industrial partners; facilitates contacts and conversations between PENRA faculty and potential PENRA collaborators; executes the required processes to attract additional membership; facilitates internal activities as required to assure the understanding and alignment of PENRA and internal organizational needs; provides leadership to assure contractual and governance requirements of the PENRA collaboration are met; participates in work sessions and technical planning activities as appropriate; utilizes business and industry experience to form responsive strategies and assure alignment with industry partner expectations; explores opportunities for collaboration with parallel efforts underway globally in alternative natural rubber programs.

Also, this position is responsible for relationships with Ohio Department of Development Services and other funding agencies as appropriate; ensures that university/industry relationships are clearly articulated, and appropriate stakeholders engaged; builds external networks to create value-added relationships between the university and the private sector; supports relationships with regional economic organizations such as Rev 1 Ventures, TechColumbus, BioOhio, BiOhio, PolymerOhio, JobsOhio, and Columbus 2020 to further the interests of the PENRA, and coordinate activities that support job and company growth in Ohio.

entry.title: Tutor
entry.content: Student Athlete Support Services tutors will demonstrate knowledge of effective teaching skills and classroom management techniques; employs innovative and creative instructional techniques; strong and effective interpersonal skills, sensitivity and understanding of concerns and issues of student-athletes; maintains a positive learning environment and keeps student-athletes engaged in the learning process; monitors and evaluates academic process; provides daily reports via Grades First on students; progress efforts to Athletic Academic Counselors; provides tutoring and academic direction for student-athletes in study table and other scheduled situations; tutors student-athletes during study table and other assigned sessions; supervises student-athletes in study situations; available Monday-Friday between 8 am to 2 pm with a minimum of 20-25 hours a week; available to work some evenings and weekends.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a term 100% FTE fall semester position. The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Coordinator-Student Programs
entry.content: Reporting to the Chief Student Life and Retention Officer, this position helps advance the goals of diversity, inclusion, and multicultural awareness at The Ohio State University at Mansfield. Accordingly, the Coordinator will work closely with students, faculty, staff, parents, and others to positively influence the development of a vibrant campus community that in turn helps students grow into responsible, active citizens who are prepared to make substantial contributions to increasingly diverse and multicultural communities locally, nationally, and globally. The person in this role will be expected to understand best practices in student development, retention, leadership, and the first year experience.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: This position will work with the Ohio AFRI grant entitled: Community Based Participatory Research Model in Preventing Overweight and Obesity Among 6th-8th Grade Children in Low Income, Racial/Ethnic Communities. This position will complete community assessments, yearly follow-up, and data collection and analysis; work with the intervention community to provide the Community Based Research Participatory components and other communication with both the control and intervention communities; utilize software programs for data collection and analysis for Ohio’s research data; communicate effectively and work cooperatively with multistate program coordinators involved in this grant.

entry.title: Fiscal Associate
entry.content:
This position is responsible for operation of School of Environment and Natural Resources (SENR) office located on the Wooster Campus of The Ohio State University; coordinates information flow, document preparation, and fiscal and personnel support activities for SENR-Wooster, and creates and maintains physical and electronic filing system for departmental activities; makes decisions related to office procedures and improvement, and performs complex office duties in support of SENR-Wooster administrative functions, including: maintaining personnel and fiscal records; provides administrative support for research activities including project budgeting and reporting; transmits administrative directives; orders supplies and manages basic office needs (e.g., office supplies, copiers,); and handles confidential materials.

In addition to providing key support to SENR-Wooster faculty, staff, and students, position supports the fiscal administration of SENR. Duties include: approving eRequest transactions for SENR-Wooster personnel; provides back-up approval of eRequest transactions for the SENR fiscal manager; initiates journal transaction corrections for SENR; reconciles monthly SENR-Wooster accounts; processes monthly vehicle billing for SENR vehicles; and functions as travel initiator for SENR-Wooster faculty, staff, and students.

entry.title: Assistant Professor - Practice
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Pharmacy invites applications for a position at the rank of Assistant Professor – Practice. This Faculty position is responsible for instruction in the second year Professional Practice Laboratory. The candidate will be part of a team of faculty teaching in the Professional Practice Laboratory series and will be a member of the Division of Pharmacy Practice and Administration. The position will report to the Director of the Professional Practice Laboratory. Primary responsibilities of this position are to participate in the development, implementation, and teaching of instructional exercises in the Professional Practice Laboratory series. This includes participation in delivery of didactic lectures, development of lab activities, evaluation of student work, course administration duties and curricular revision. Course content includes aspects from various pharmacy settings including community and hospital pharmacy practice.

Candidates must demonstrate exceptional communication skills and a desire to be engaged in the clinical education of pharmacy students. The successful candidate will also precept fourth year pharmacy students, pharmacy practice residents and graduate teaching assistants who also participate in these courses.

entry.title: Research Assistant 2-B/H
entry.content:
The Ohio State University College of Dentistry seeks a Research Assistant to join its Orthodontics Division. This is a grant-funded up to one year term position, which may be renewable based on funding. The Orthodontics Division provides excellent, comprehensive orthodontic treatment for all ages. The orthodontic faculty members are leaders in their profession, and you will work with respected clinicians, researchers and educators to provide the best care to our patients. The Ohio State University College of Dentistry is the fourth largest public dental school in the United States and it is the only public dental school in Ohio. The college is divided into ten divisions or academic units. All major ADA-recognized dental specialties are represented. The College has approximately 600 students in its undergraduate and graduate programs.

The Research Assistant will be responsible for cell culture, RNA/DNA protein isolation, conduct bioanalytical assays, perform histologic and imnunohistological analysis, and assist with surgical preparation. Providing routine research lab management and maintenance is also a part of the position. This position may include evening and weekend work on occasion; requires successful completion of a drug & alcohol screening; must be able to: use of both hands, dexterity in the fingers and the ability to manipulate instruments, materials, and operate equipment; ability to sit and stand for a duration of time is also necessary; other specific requirements include color spectrum differentiation; manual dexterity/motor coordination, hand-eye coordination, physical communications; visual acuity and communication/language development. Individuals in this position may be exposed to the following: animals; chemical hazards (skin irritants); vibrating equipment; use of sharp instruments; and latex.

entry.title: Post Doctoral Researcher
entry.content:
The Ohio State University’s John Glenn College of Public Affairs and Department of Political Science welcome applicants for a two-year Postdoctoral Researcher position with the Education Governance and Accountability Project. The purpose of the project is to improve understanding of the political institutions governing U.S. public education, so that they may be designed to promote democratic accountability and the efficient provision of K-12 education. The postdoctoral researcher will help lead the collection of a decade of data on local school district elections across 20 states and assist in the analysis and dissemination of these data. S/he also will be given time to work on her/his own research and will have research opportunities related to the project.

The position begins July 1, 2016 and ends June 30, 2018. Salary will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications and the successful candidate will receive a stipend to help cover moving costs. Applicants must have completed or be nearing completion of all Ph.D. degree requirements. Successful candidates will likely have doctorates in political science, public affairs, or a related discipline; possess strong administrative skills; and have significant experience working with large datasets.

The Ohio State University is committed to establishing a culturally and intellectually diverse environment, encouraging all members of our learning community to reach their full potential. The postdoctoral researcher will have work space in the John Glenn College of Public Affairs. The College is located in a state-of-the-art building, Page Hall, in the center of the University campus.

The Ohio State University, the flag-ship public university of Ohio, is located in the state’s capital, Columbus, providing direct access to public sector organizations and practitioners from all levels of government, as well as a large and vibrant nonprofit and philanthropic community. Columbus is the 15th largest city in the United States, has a relatively low cost of living, and was recently rated by Forbes as the No. 1 opportunity city in the country.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: This position, within the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry, is responsible for the operation of the Wonders of our World (WOW) science outreach program; performs volunteer recruitment, experiment development, testing, and revision; supplies procurement and preparation of transportation logistics; assists with data collection for program evaluation; schedules and provides instruction for teacher and volunteer workshops and schedules volunteer visits to local schools; supervises student support staff and serves as the liaison and primary contact for all program participants; researches funding sources and assists with writing grant proposals; assists program director with preparation of proposals; interacts with community members at a variety of events; facilitates program expansion to other colleges and universities by serving as a consultant for program leaders at other institutions; trains and supervises students; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Program Manager
entry.content: This position coordinates an educational and training program designed to recruit, educate, and train The Ohio State University College of Social Work's Bachelor of Science in Social Work (BSSW) and Master’s of Social Work (MSW) students to work in the field of child welfare; Administration of the program includes recruitment and selection of students, administration and financial oversight, teaching child welfare courses and seminars, field liaison management, training and supervision of students and field supervisors, planning and development with state University Partnership Title IV-E Child Welfare Training Program (UPP) participating universities, networking activities with state and county public children services agencies and associations, and data management and evaluation.

entry.title: D-Marketing and Communication
entry.content: Under minimal guidance and supervision from the Chief Advancement Officer, the CVM Communications and Marketing Director serves as the strategic communications and marketing professional for the College; manages and establishes key public relations, media outlet relationships and oversees the development and execution of a comprehensive strategic communications, marketing and branding plan, including a plan for crisis communications to pro-actively promote and strengthen the brand, visibility, stature, and reputation of the College; develops digital communications plans and social media strategies and provides oversight of the College web and social media presence; in collaboration with the Chief Advancement Officer, Associate Dean for Faculty and Staff Affairs, and VMC Director of Marketing, leads the development and delivery of external communications to CVM faculty, staff and students; provides advice on and crafts internal messages; designs promotional and fundraising materials, including brochures, newsletters, website content; develops and manages balanced messaging surrounding education discovery, service and outreach involving faculty, staff, students and alumni; develops communication and marketing materials for advancement (development, alumni engagement, etc.); works with the VMC Marketing Director, University Communications and other health sciences communicators on communications and marketing materials; develops and manages the production of College publications, including newsletters, annual reports and press releases and contributes to the development of materials for special events, campaigns, programs, and informational pieces, in accordance with the College’s branding/identity guidelines; responsible for maintaining coherent visual standards throughout all marketing and communications efforts related to the College and the University; responsible for the development, integration, and implementation of a broad range of public relations activities relative to the strategic direction and positioning of the College and its leadership; serves as an integral, contributing member of the CVM Advancement team; primary liaison to University Communications and Media Relations to ensure alignment with Ohio State brand guidelines, and collaborates with Legal Affairs as it relates to compliance issues related to brand, trademarks and licensing, contracts, sponsorships; manages contracts with vendors, maintains budgets and other planning principles to ensure successful product delivery and that communications are consistent and in line with the College and its departments, Advancement, and university goals and objectives; provides oversight of the College web presence and supervises one full-time staff member.

entry.title: Research Assistant 1-B/H
entry.content: This position performs laboratory research processing sensitive environmental soil samples, specifically assisting in nucleic acid and protein extraction for generation of metagenomes, metatranscriptomes, and metaproteomes; conducts quality control of extracted biomolecules, rigorous organization and attention to detail; analyzes and manages data; participates in research discussions; assists in daily operation of laboratory; maintains and operates research equipment; requisitions supplies; records and reports experimental results; assists in training new students.

entry.title: Research Assistant 1-Social
entry.content: Interviewer will be trained to contact and recruit participants, schedule interviews, collect and enter data, document project-related activities, and administer computer, smartphone and/or paper-based surveys; collect biologic samples and deliver them to the laboratory; attend trainings and regular staff meetings (often by phone); screen and recruit potential research participants; schedule interviews; obtain informed consent; conduct interviews at participants homes; collect survey data and biological specimens (urine and saliva) following research protocol; ensures completeness, quality and accuracy in the collection, labeling, documentation, and transmission of questionnaires and specimens; manages inventory of research forms and specimen collection materials; provides coverage for other interviewers in case of absence; maintains small freezer and research supplies (all provided by OSU) in home; maintains accurate, complete, and confidential records of data collected following research protocol; works effectively with participants of different ages, genders, and cultural backgrounds; must be available to work evenings and weekends.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
Open Faculty Search, tenure track faculty position at any level (assistant, associate or full professor) will participate in teaching, research and service in the Department of Molecular Genetics and the Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center and Division of Endocrinology; expected to participate in formal undergraduate and graduate courses and advising graduate students; establishes strong, creative, and competitive program in endocrine cancer biology research area, but not limited to, cancer biology including genetics, metabolism, signaling, cell cycle, cell differentiation, DNA repair, transcription, DNA replication, checkpoint control, cachexia, aging, metastasis, therapeutic resistance, and tumor microenvironment.

entry.title: Delivery Worker 2
entry.content: This position serves as an active member of a diverse Logistics and Distribution department; picks up, sorts and delivers surplus materials from colleges and departments to the Stores Surplus warehouse; operates up to 20 foot long straight truck; loads and unloads vehicles; utilizes appropriate freight moving equipment as needed; maintains delivery records; inspects and maintains cleanliness of vehicles; reports vehicle problems to supervisor for repair; maintains documents associated with delivery manifests, productivity cards and vehicle records.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content: The Ohio State University (www.osu.edu) invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position (focusing on the rank of Associate or Full Professor) in the newly created Department of Engineering Education (EED). Our newly formed Department (http://eed.osu.edu) is expanding its core team of faculty. The Department’s mission includes advancing the engineering profession and enabling student success by 1) developing and delivering state-of-the-art, innovative, multidisciplinary engineering courses and programs 2) modeling and advocating scholarly, evidence-based teaching within the College of Engineering; and 3) integrating pedagogical discovery, practice, and dissemination through world-class engineering education research. The EED emerges from the Engineering Education and Innovation Center (EEIC) which has a curriculum founded on first-year core courses, technical communication, multi-disciplinary capstone, and other specialized courses and programs. The EED is currently growing its Ph.D. program. This position will start August 2016.

entry.title: Admissions Couns And Staff Ast
entry.content: General responsibilities for this position include representing the institution at college fairs, K-12 school visits, and other community events; conducting interviews and group information sessions regarding admission and financial aid procedures; reviewing applications and maintaining correspondence with prospective students throughout the recruitment/application cycle; developing on-campus programs for area middle and high school students; assisting students with the financial aid application process; troubleshooting admission and financial aid problems in cooperation with other staff.

entry.title: Director-A5
entry.content: The Sr. Director, Social Media at The Ohio State University is responsible for developing, implementing, measuring and optimizing a social media strategy that will further the brand building, engagement and lead generation goals across the university. The ideal candidate will possess initiative and have a passion for their craft that lends itself to creating an impact on the Ohio State community. They must thrive on being a part of a continuous learning environment that builds strong, collaborative relationships, welcome best practices, reach for new bounds, and operate as a center of excellence. He/she will seek fresh insights, recognizing good ideas can come from anywhere. This position will desire to work with his/her marketing colleagues to create an energetic, committed and fun Marketing organization. The Sr. Director must be able to work autonomously, prioritize work, identify business needs and participate in the development of solutions.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a temporary 40% FTE fall semester position.
The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Open Faculty Search
entry.content:
Fisher College of Business at The Ohio State University invites applications for a tenure-track faculty assistant professor position in the Department of Marketing and Logistics. The faculty position is partially funded by The Ohio State University's Discovery Themes Initiative, a significant faculty hiring investment in key thematic areas in which the university can build on its culture of academic collaboration to make a global impact. Spanning these key areas is a collaborative effort to support Data Analytics for delivering solutions that harness the power of big data. Candidates are expected to participate in this initiative. Additional information about the Discovery Themes Initiative is available at https://discovery.osu.edu/.

The Ohio State University is committed to establishing a culturally and intellectually diverse environment, encouraging all members of our learning community to reach their full potential. We are responsive to dual-career families and strongly promote work-life balance to support our community members through a suite of institutionalized policies. We are an NSF Advance Institution and a member of the Ohio/Western Pennsylvania/West Virginia Higher Education Recruitment Consortium.

entry.title: OSU Extension Educator
entry.content: The Extension Educator, Agriculture and Natural Resources in Cuyahoga County, will provide overall leadership to developing and conducting a proactive applied research and education program in agriculture and natural resources to meet current and future needs in commercial horticulture (Green Industry), home horticulture/Master Gardeners, metro-regional food systems, innovative horticultural/agricultural business opportunities, environmental quality and sustainability, and food security; work collaboratively with the team of Extension professionals to provide agriculture and natural resources programming within the Western Reserve Extension Education and Research Area (EERA); plan, teach, deliver, disseminate, and evaluate educational programs on commercial horticulture (Green Industry), home horticulture/Master Gardeners, innovative urban agricultural opportunities, metro-regional food systems, food safety/security, environmental quality/sustainability, water quality, natural resources, innovative approaches to crop production, and urban agricultural profitability; give leadership to the development of pro-active educational programs using innovative educational methods; maintain a high level of visibility and facilitate communications with a wide range of clientele including traditional and non-traditional learners, elected officials, agricultural and non-agricultural stakeholders, and environmental and special interest groups to promote the understanding of agriculture and natural resource issues; maintain a program of individual professional improvement in selected subject areas; develop effective advisory committees; work closely with local advisory committees, commodity groups, and volunteers to conduct needs assessment and priority setting to determine emphasis of educational programs; serve as an educational advisor and liaison for OSU Extension and the University to appropriate public issue and program-related organizations; represent OSU Extension and the University with federal, state, and local agencies and educational institutions at the local community level; identify, recruit, and develop the volunteer leadership necessary to carry out relevant parts of their programming; provide volunteer management, educational training, and program development to the Summit County Master Gardener Volunteer Program.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: This position provides high level of strategic support to the Chief Advancement Officer (CAO) for the College of Engineering and Advancement team; serves as point of contact and liaison to internal and external stakeholders; monitors and oversees development initiatives and strategies, and manages special projects for Advancement; provides logistics for the College of Engineering’s Advancement operation, including management of itineraries and strategic coordination of donor interactions; coordinates local and regional donor cultivation activities; manages alumni, prospect, and suspect information, data analysis, and research; handles inquiries and resolves concerns regarding contributions or other alumni or donor issues; coordinates visits with major donors; provides administrative support to CAO and Advancement team when needed.

entry.title: Professor
entry.content:
Ohio Eminent Scholar in scientific computation: Will be someone who will be a leader in the research field of scientific computation and will carry out interdisciplinary research forging new connections with other departments at The Ohio State University and other institutions. It is expected that this faculty member will be significantly engaged with the graduate and undergraduate programs in the Mathematics Dept, e.g. directing PhD, Master's thesis or undergraduate research. This position is partially funded by Ohio State’s Discovery Themes Initiative, a significant faculty hiring investment in key thematic areas in which the university can build on its culture of academic collaboration to make a global impact.

entry.title: Early Childhood Teaching Ast 1
entry.content: This is an Infant/Toddler Age Level Position. Hours vary between 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., Monday through Friday. Assists in supervising and integrating daily and long-term planning for the classroom in collaboration with support team and other classroom team members; ensures social, emotional, physical, and educational needs of children are met based on Center's philosophy, curriculum policies and state licensing rules; assists with implementing, evaluating, and communicating classroom programming, routines, and procedures; assists in management of classroom by completing paperwork, training, evaluating staff, and problem solving with team and parents to address classroom issues; implements health, safety and security processes and procedures including CACFP meal counting; participates in professional development and on center wide and university teams.

entry.title: Systems Developer/Engineer
entry.content: Contributes to ensuring that the Office of the CIO IT systems are compliant with applicable regulations, group policies, codes, industry best practices, and the Security Framework/Strategy; where gaps are identified, assist in defining improvements and implementing appropriate controls; supports OCIO Infrastructure teams in aligning risk, compliance, and audit efforts, and coordinating efforts toward mitigating risks identified through Enterprise Security's Information Risk Framework; provides oversight of information security within infrastructure; communicates security gaps and priorities with team members; works with Director to determine best way to implement standards for each area; assists in preparing area response to information security risk assessments.

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content:
Assistant Professor in Analysis, Combinatorics, Geometric Group Theory, or Number Theory. The ideal candidate will be someone who can easily communicate and collaborate with other faculty members working in other research areas that are currently represented in the Mathematics Department at The Ohio State University. It is expected that this faculty member will be significantly engaged with the graduate and undergraduate programs in the Mathematics Dept e.g. directing Phd, Master's theses, and or undergraduate research.

entry.title: Academic Advisor And Staff Ast
entry.content: This position assists with advising for two undergraduate programs of study in the Electrical & Computer Engineering Department for over 1,000 students with an emphasis on prospective and pre-major students; advises students on program requirements, academic standards, course selection, quarter to semester transition, and opportunities for co-op/internship/placement, minors, senior petition, honors, distinction projects, B.S./M.S., and graduate school; coordinates domestic freshman orientation; participates in pre-admission advising, attends recruitment events, and serves as primary contact for prospective high school and transfer students; coordinates and teaches survey course(s); assists with admission of students to major; meets with students regarding probation, dismissal, Fresh Start, and reinstatement; assists with certification of graduates for degree, compliant to university/department guidelines; processes petitions and posts exceptions in student tracking systems; serves on committees and participates in focus groups and in professional development to achieve goals consistent with the mission of the college and department; proposes changes to policy and procedures and to on-line and printed advising materials; promotes communication among a diverse student population and the College, Engineering Career Services, Disability Services, Admissions, Registrar's, Veteran and Military Services, and athletic offices; responds to inquiries; resolves problems; maintains student files and statistics.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content:
From business as usual to business unusual, Fisher College of Business prepares students to go beyond and make an immediate impact in their careers through top-ranked programs, distinguished faculty and a vast network of partnerships that reaches from the surrounding business community to multinationals, nonprofits and startups across the globe. Our students are uniquely prepared and highly sought, leveraging Fisher’s rigorous, experiential learning environment with the resources of Ohio State, a premiere research university with 500,000 proud Buckeye alumni.

This position provides a broad range of specialized oversight and support for program management activities in the delivery of Executive Education degree and non-degree offerings; responsible for the coordination of program logistics including the scheduling of classroom facilities, catering, transportation, and required learning technologies; facilitates participant communications and responds to informational requests; oversees participant registrations and the management of participant databases; implements program assessment activities; contributes to the program improvement process; pays and tracks program expenses; serves as a liaison to faculty in preparing program presentations, materials, and supplies; assists with the faculty contracting process and facilitates faculty compensation; processes travel and reimbursement requests; oversees and supports training and development needs of staff; serves as a direct contact for client inquiries and requests on designated programs; collaborates with Program Manager/Program Director on special projects and provides backup support in absence of Program Manager/Program Director; supports other related Executive Education activities and events as assigned.

entry.title: Grants & Contracts Specialist
entry.content: This position manages pre- and post-award activities for research group(s); researches, collects and compiles information to prepare proposals and budget which meet department, college, university and agency requirements; participates in grant proposal preparation for large program projects and other types of projects/grants including writing generic sections of proposals and preparing data tables for training grant proposals; directs and coordinates activities to ensure smooth transition from submission of proposal to funding of project and to close-out of the award; provides assistance to research staff and faculty in the coordination and preparation of research reports; monitors and oversees financial aspects of active research grants and other pending projects; ensures financial compliance with federal, state and local regulations, and guidelines for research; coordinates with faculty, researchers, staff and students to ensure proper procedures are followed with grant expenditures; plans and supervises preparation of site visits by research sponsors and regulatory agencies; assists faculty and senior staff with complex proposals or budgetary projects; monitors current operating and research budgets to ensure overall spending and individual projects are within budget including reconciling funds on a monthly basis; works with faculty to encourage and facilitate the pursuit of collaborative grants as well as individual faculty grants; researches, evaluates and recommends funding opportunities to principal investigators; contributes to development of industrial collaborators; serves as ex officio member of the Industrial Liaison Committee; tracks industry contacts and updates with a database; develops marketing materials to promote research capabilities of the faculty; develops new website content to facilitate faculty and industry collaborations; other duties as assigned.

entry.title: Research Aide
entry.content: This position assists with applied, soil carbon-focused research in a team-oriented soil physics lab; research work is embedded in a project focused on the comparison of long-term effects of conventional vs. organic agricultural practices on soil organic carbons stocks; works in the laboratory measuring soil bulk density, pH, inorganic and organic C, and N content (processing and weighing samples, and using a C/N Autoanalyzer); enters research results into excel spreadsheets.

entry.title: Associate General Counsel
entry.content:
The Office of Legal Affairs, under the direction of the Senior Vice President and General Counsel, provides legal representation and advice to the University and all of its constituent parts, including the Board of Trustees, the President, Provost, faculty and academic departments, the Office of Research, Student Life, Athletics, the Department of Public Safety, the Office of Business and Finance, and The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center, among many others. As one of the largest universities in the nation, Ohio State is a multifaceted institution, with a sophisticated and leading-edge legal practice that touches nearly every area of law, including litigation, labor and employment, public contracting, intellectual property, research and technology transfer, business transactions, taxation and benefits, administrative law, health care law, public safety and criminal law matters, federal and state constitutional and public law issues, and more.

The Associate General Counsel will focus on academic and student affairs, employment, University policies and procedures, and public law issues. The Associate General Counsel will be a key legal, policy, and strategic advisor to the colleges, schools, and academic departments across the University and for other units and projects as assigned. Responsibilities will also include crisis management and critical incident response, litigation, policy development and implementation, advising on regulatory and compliance matters, and developing and participating in training and preventative law efforts.

All University attorneys are expected to work at the highest professional level with integrity, excellent judgment, attention to detail, and discretion, and to demonstrate the highest personal and leadership characteristics of teamwork, inclusiveness, calmness, and adaptability to a broad range of issues, people, and situations.

entry.title: Post Doctoral Researcher
entry.content: A Post-Doctoral Researcher position in visual perception is available at The Ohio State University College of Optometry. Topical research areas for investigation include: middle level visual information processing with emphasis on binocular processing and perceptual learning in binocular vision in normal and clinical populations; research studies are conducted using the typical psychophysical methods; will recruit and conduct human submit testing; prepare data for statistical analysis; prepare scientific manuscripts and conduct presentations of research.

entry.title: Office Associate
entry.content: This position will serve as the primary contact for internal and external customers; answer telephones, route mail, and assists customers in person; enter e-Requests (purchasing and p-card purchases); maintain and monitor financial account information; operate computers to produce routine and complex or technical documents (e.g. reports, letters, manuscripts, etc.); draft and modify correspondence; distribute and mail final copies; produce documents for mass mailing.

entry.title: Professor
entry.content: Conducts research in the area of chemical catalysis that is relevant to the general field of sustainable chemistry and with potential application in synthesis or polymer chemistry are strongly encouraged to apply; will be engaged in the Sustainable and Resilient Economy (SRE) program (https://discovery.osu.edu/SRE) with a highly collaborative interdisciplinary community of scholars from Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Health Sciences, Economics and Business; lead or participate in collaborative teams and interdisciplinary research with the Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering, and the broader community of scholars; teaches graduate and undergraduate courses; maintains an active research program; advises students; performs service functions for the department, college, and university.

entry.title: Research Assistant 1-B/H
entry.content: The Research Assistant I position will participate in a variety of lab and field based projects in chemical ecology, phylogenetics, metagenomics, and evolution. Current projects focus on the behavioral ecology and life history evolution of Megalomyrmex social parasites, the evolution of semiochemicals of the fungus growing ants and Megalomyrmex ants, and the transmission of ant associated microbes. This position will lead projects will be outline with supervision but then completed and written for publication by research assistant.

entry.title: Administrative Associate 1
entry.content: The education abroad program manager is a critical contributor to the Office of International Affairs mission of facilitating and administering accessible education abroad programming of high academic quality for Ohio State students. As a member of a highly motivated and productive team, the program manager develops and manages budgets for 50 to 60 faculty-led Ohio State education abroad programs from program planning through execution and closure; manages internal processes for setting program fees; and creates and maintains internal data bases as needed. Using knowledge of OSU purchasing and travel policies and procedures and in consultation with the International Affairs Business Operations, the program manager supports, trains and advises staff and faculty directors on procurement of services and budget development for programs on a continual basis; serves as unit consultant and expert for education abroad program fee setting process and international travel logistics and arrangements; has the delegated signature authority from the Director to review and approve fiscal transactions for budget and appropriateness; in compliance with University and unit processes and expectations, the program manager organizes, leads, and manages the competitive bid process for all bid-eligible education abroad programs as well as supplemental insurance, travel services and other services as needed; developing and guiding unit procedures for submission and review of program specifications and competitive bids to ensure quality control and compliance; working closely with International Affairs Business Operations, regularly initiates and manages complex communications related to program logistics and fiscal arrangements with education abroad coordinators, college education abroad liaisons, faculty directors, host institutions, and travel providers; develops and administers 3 to 5 education abroad programs in conjunction with academic units; advises and orients students and faculty participating on programs; monitors and evaluates programs in consultation with relevant faculty and academic units; performs other duties as assigned, including back-up emergency first responder on occasional basis.

entry.title: Research Aide
entry.content: Assists the Manager of Stone Laboratory; assists in preparation of summer program; assists in operation of Stone Lab Fieldtrip Program; assists in operation of Aquatic Visitor Center; assists in preparation and maintenance of facilities for utilization by visitors, faculty, researchers, and students; provides assistance to secretary and laboratory managers as needed; conducts inventory of supplies and equipment; maintains and repairs scientific equipment; leads tours, science cruises, laboratory sessions, and activities for visiting groups; provides information about fieldtrip program; assists in construction and storage of educational displays; conducts orientation sessions for visiting groups; assists in seasonal set-up and close-down procedures for the laboratory; performs special assignments as needed; position is a temporary appointment that will last from mid-April to late October, 2016 (flexible beginning and end dates); position located at Put-In-Bay, Ohio. There are six available positions with this job opening.

entry.title: Program Coordinator
entry.content: This position will work with a team of Extension professionals and in collaboration with advisory committees to plan and organize 4-H youth development activities, projects, and programs; plan and teach volunteer training programs; develop and select training materials from a variety of sources; interview, hire, and train new volunteers based on curricula; work with fairboards; teach and train volunteers; ensure club volunteers are compliant with policies; receive callers and visitors with regard to the 4-H program; plan and organize project judging day, including selection of judges; teach judges and volunteers; direct staff and volunteers in planning and implementing recognition/appreciation event; revise and update fair guide and project evaluation guidelines; teach project-specific activities based on enrollment; work with staff and volunteers to plan events and activities; teach audiences about the impacts of 4-H; conduct activities including 4-H Week; promote 4-H camping program; oversee the preparation of and adoption of a variety of new ways to promote 4-H in the county.

entry.title: Program Associate-Grad School
entry.content: The Graduate School provides leadership for graduate education at The Ohio State University. It fosters quality in graduate education and research by ensuring high standards for 200 plus graduate degree programs and by providing essential services that support the work of approximately 10,000 graduate students and more than 3,000 graduate faculty and staff. Each of the regular 23 Graduate School staff members contributes both individually and collectively to meeting the mission of the Graduate School. Coordinates the day to day administrative activities of the Graduate Student Recruitment and Diversity Initiatives (GSRDI) office in the Graduate School; assists senior director with supervision of graduate administrative associates (GAAs); acts on behalf of senior director as necessary; sustains awareness of current and ongoing social justice issues along the lines of access and equity, particularly related to historically underrepresented groups at predominantly majority campus; coordinates the logistics for all activities associated with the Summer Research Opportunities Program (SROP), including making travel arrangements for participants, arranging meals and lodging, and initiating all associated eTravel and eRequests; assists with SROP budget planning and tracking; coordinates extensive recruitment travel for the Senior Director, GAAs, and other university employees recruiting on behalf of the Graduate School; assists with the logistics of and/or attends various recruitment activities/events to represent the Graduate School; maintains relevant program databases to track and report program participant outcomes; works closely with Graduate School IT staff and Graduate and Professional Admissions to access reports and compile data necessary data for routine reporting as well as ad-hoc reports upon request; coordinates various name exchange lists; acts as liaison between the Committee on Institutional Cooperation and GSRDI, as well as between GRSDI and other university offices, such as the Office of Diversity and Inclusion, Graduate and Professional Admissions, and graduate academic programs; participates in university committees relevant to GRSDI; coordinates communication of various program information and distribution of materials to and from university units, faculty, staff, and students; works on special projects and programs as assigned by the Senior Director and/or other leadership of the Graduate School.

entry.title: Staff Associate E
entry.content:
This position is a temporary 100% FTE fall semester position.
The exact responsibilities will be communicated to you via email by the General Chemistry Lab Supervisor at least one week before the start of the semester. Potential assignments include teaching recitations; serving as Head TA for a lab section; 8 hours of lab supervision; 8 additional hours of LRC supervision; or an 8 hour course coordination assignment.

Typical duties for a Head TA assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; participates in training and mentoring of Lab TAs; participates in coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; evaluates lab methods and instructional techniques and provides prep assistance; assists with responding to TA and student lab emails.

Typical duties for a lab supervision assignment include: Walks through a certain number of designated lab sections in order to train, mentor, and monitor other lab TAs; Assists with leading weekly staff meetings; develops TA resources for the TA Forum (including experimental checklists, FAQs, and improved content); generates standard lab walking notes; participates in planning, coordination, analysis, and implementation of labs; serves as a primary contact for TA and student lab questions.

Typical duties for a LRC supervision assignment include: Serves as the Learning Resource Center Supervisor for a certain number of hours per week; trains, mentors, and monitors other general chemistry TAs during assigned Learning Resource Center shifts; generates weekly reports regarding personnel in the Learning Resource Center and offers suggestions to improve the Learning Resource Center; fields student content questions from any general chemistry course.

entry.title: Patron Services Coord WCA
entry.content: As a member of the Wexner Center for the Arts Patron Services team (Visitor and Ticketing Services, House Management, Facility Rentals and Special Events, The Store), this individual will be responsible for implementing a consistently positive experience for the Center's patrons and visitors, consistent with the institution's mission and brand; in collaboration with the Patron Services Manager, responsible for on-site patron services including all aspects of the ticketing of Wexner and rental events; provides input into areas that interact with the public with consultatory relationship to other departments regarding patron services; assists in hiring, training, and supervising part time patron services student staff; must be flexible and available to work evenings, weekends, and holidays; use of personal vehicle may be required (mileage reimbursed).
